page.title: 14Sport (1) at Mousehole
page.content: {Mousehole Association Football {Club}was started in 1922 by a group of local boys. During this time it has played on three pitches which have all had to be some distance from the village because there is no flat land large enough close to the village. Since 1962 their pitch has been at {Trungle Moor, Paul,}on some reclaimed land. The Club has run up to five teams and this means that a lot of money has to be raised to support them. At one time nearly everone in the village went to the matches and the teams were selected from mainly local men. Now many of the players come from the surrounding districts and only the 'faithful few' follow the fortunes of the teams and work hard to keep the club going. One of the main sources of money raising is the{Carnival Week.
